Republicans have already cut health care benefits to hundreds of thousands of veterans who served during the Vietnam War . In 2001, the Republican Congress controlled the House Senate and White House and passed what the Republicans laughingly called the Deficit Reduction . I was personally affected. I was drafted during the Vietnam War and was lucky enough to spend myÂ obligation in an artillery unit in Germany. I was eligible for VA Healthcare but never signed up for it as I had employer provided health care. I considered VA Healthcare a safety net that I would use if I ever lost Healthcare benefits. I was forced into early retirement by a corporate merger and would not haveÂ healthcare coverage for five years when I would become eligible for Medicare. When I went to the VA to sign up I was informed I was no longer eligibleÂ for VA Healthcare. The 2001 Deficit Reduction changed the eligiblity criteria for VA Healthcare. Eligibility was restricted only to Vetnam War veterans who had won the purple heart, or were a POW or lived below the federal poverty level.
I was drafted and served along with other Cold War and Vietnam War Era politicians including such diverse people as Ralph Nader and Ron Paul. Mitt Romney, Newt GIngrich and Dick Cheney all avoided the draft by fighting for and getting draft defferments for such excuses as a religious exemption (Mitt Romney) or school and marriageÂ exemptions (Dick Cheney, Newt Gingrich).
